Reviews.Title: “Family Suite is only good for immediate family”
Reviews.Author: SmileKitten
Reviews.Content: I made a mistake from the very beginning. I was mislead by the words in their website and choose the family suite for our extended family. So when we entered the room, we are so surprised. There is only one living room with TV, sofa chair, table, microwave and refrigerator and ONE BEDROOM, with two queen-sized bed pushed together. Basically it's only suitable for immediate family. For extended family, you need to book two rooms instead. There are no extra electrical outlet in the room, if you need to charge you handphone, use notebook etc. remember to bring your own extension cord. The TV contents is very limited, only free channels so arrange your own. We were given two cards for the suite, however, each card controls the electricity of one room. So if any of your family member needs to come back later, either someone must stay up and open the door for him or he takes the card and leave one room black. The staff in reception is not so friendly. Our request of earlier check-in is turned down because there is people live in our room the last day. Despite they request guests to check-out before 10:30am, the cleaning job can only be completed after 2:30 pm. The location is excellent. Very convenient. A large food court, supermarket nearby, as well as quite a lot entertainments. We were given two free tickets. Each ticket entitled two people to enter water park, or 2 hours play in ExploreKids for 1 child. In conclusion, the resort is only good for BBQ. Probably it's the only place in Singapore, you can BBQ until 1-3 am. It's not a very ideal weekends getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for gatherings”
Reviews.Author: desire348
Reviews.Content: Room for 4 pax, comes with microwave but no proper table to do cutting of food.ppl are there to have gatherings and held birthday parties, so expect the amt of noise thruout the night. Nearby amenities include a small shopping mall next to it and the wild wild wet theme park.

Reviews.Title: “Different...........”
Reviews.Author: AKiwiandACanuck
Reviews.Content: Ok, you get what you pay for. We had two nights here to break up the trip from NZ. It was a cheaper option than most of the proper hotels in Singapore. We were the only non locals there. Very busy as it was school holidays. The room had four single beds pushed together. As other reviews say it is very noisy at night. The water park next door is great, as is the pool at the resort. Easy walk to the MRT stop. Since the resort is attached to a mall, shopping and food is close by. A $19 taxi ride from Changi airport. Overall....an OK option if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Noise Pollution!”
Reviews.Author: SforSingapore
Reviews.Content: A good and economical stay. Simple and well-equipped rooms with many facilities, eateries, activities and shops around the Resort. It is always flooded with local families and teenagers during weekends and school holidays. I DO NOT recommend this place for those who are light sleepers. Notices have been placed in the room that no loud noise is allowed after 11pm but people still talk and laugh very loud till the Wee hours. They are not considerate at all. I stayed there many times and each time i either have to call the security to complain about the loud noise or ask the guests who make the loud noise to SHUT UP personally. I do not recommend this place for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect customer service. Noisy room.”
Reviews.Author: FollowLee
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking about moderate sort of resort or hotel kind of service to be provided in this place, give up the idea. This is definitely not a place for tourists or even the locals. Reason is very simple, there is no customer service at this place. Of most of the places (hotels/resorts) I have been to, this is a place with an abandoned customer service with fair environment. It is totally not accessible to the seaside and far away from it with disappointment. The room is spacious but very noisy and not good for resting even you switch on the TV almost to the full volume. There are 4 beds in the SAFRA room (members), one big fridge. Overall the price is expensive unless less than $60 per night (for it's overall rating). Look out for discounts or vouchers on the Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Its nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: AviAgg
Reviews.Content: Its a real resort, it has a water park, there is a big market in this resort, it is near to MRT Station, there is a big swimming pool, there is a beach just behind the resort. But the it takes some time to reach the central Singapore, but it is a tourist sport, if you are not staying here, then you should come here some time. Avi Aggarwal

Reviews.Title: “Cheaper than most hotels, but not worth it for tourists”
Reviews.Author: W13
Reviews.Content: "Resorts" in Singapore are not for tourists but rather for the locals to have a weekend out BBQ'ing and being rowdy. We stayed here because we didn't want to endure the high prices of most Singaporean hotels (and the cheap ones that are infested with prostitutes!). We got two uncomfortable single beds pushed together and a shower that was lukewarm at best. The aircon worked very well. The walk in and out of the resort was quite long. The good thing is that there's a food-court, 24-hour McDonald's, taxi stand, and a mall within walking distance. On weekends and holidays, expect lots of rowdy people partying late into the night (even 4am). During business hours, the place is deserted! Housekeeping only comes once every other day (so don't throw your towels on the floor as you may need to reuse them!) There's also a free shuttle bus (every hour or every half hour on weekends) that can take you to the nearest MRT station (Pasir Ris) which is otherwise a 15 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not well maintained”
Reviews.Author: Homelyman
Reviews.Content: This had been a family event at the Family Suite room. It was 14Aug2011 and first day of a 3 days-2 Night package deal. I came with my family as a guest. I helped to do an inspection of the rooms condition and found some defects. The fridge is a low-cost LG brand model and had faulty ice cube makers and broken ice cube container. A bottle compartment was also missing from the side door of the main compartment. The faulty ice cubes maker would flip over easily and spill out the water. The ceiling fans unable to work from Power Select '1' position. The door frame of the toilet entrance had broken concrete. The worst...the TV reception is bad with radio interference pattern splashed across the screen and only showed Free-to-air programmes. No Cable TV programmes. Be prepared to walk on Tiled flooring, the type that is found inside a public toilet. No Free Shampoo, comb or amenities. But the management proudly declared on their wall memo that Toilet Bowls, Wash Basins are amenities provided for use. Any unreported damage found upon checking-out would be chargeable. It's more like a Refugee Camp. Luckily, there are two swimming pools that were clean and spacious and safely guarded by Life Guards.

Reviews.Title: “Not for tourists or business travellers”
Reviews.Author: WorldGlutton
Reviews.Content: My sister booked for us this resort rooms because we are having a birthday dinner at their Sakura Resturant. This resort is a family club and is packed with families for weekend , If you are planning for a quiet stay, this is not the place for you. BBQ pits are everywhere and one cannot sleep well with the noises surrounded by the smokey air oozing into your rooms. The room is small, there is no internet connection. The Resort Front Office Staff are rude and surely need lots of courtesy trainings!!. There is no phone line in the room , or there is no room service at all. The water dispenser that is in the corrider for guest convenience is not working !! Fortunately we are only staying for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Well... maybe once is enough”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Finland-73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week. We had family suite (studio) which was spacious and enough for small family (1-2 kids). Room(s) really needs renovating since they are quite old. There were some ants here and there, beds were big but a bit hard at least for me. Place is also a bit noisy, especially during the weekends, since there are BBQ pits everywhere near to rooms. I think most of ppl were locals having birthdays or some other BBQ parties. Our kid liked the swimming pool and there is also a bigger pool for adults. Location is quite good, near to Pasir Ris MRT-station (abt. 20 mins walk) and there many foodies next to resort. There is coin operated washing machine and dryer and many vending machines. Rooms has also small fridge. I woudn't stay here next time I visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “I booked it through Hostelling International and it was everything I needed it to be”
Reviews.Author: dianathecookie
Reviews.Content: I was looking for somewhere cheap to stay the night, reasonably close to the airport. I found this property through the Hostelling International listings. The room was a triple share but I had it to myself. Very clean. Spacious. Had a large fridge. Nice touches like plugs with built in international socket converter and the usual amenities like a large lockable cupboard, and reading light. The room was air-conditioned and had a fan. Bathroom was very spartan but clean as I said. Also nice in that there was a water heater for hot showers. The property itself is a large resort that seems to cater to families. Barbecue pits are available all over the place for outdoor cooking. A broad range of food options very nearby. Breakfast is included in the tarif in the form of a voucher redeemable at McDonalds and two other restaurants in the immediate area. Staff were courteous and helpful and were willing to give me a late checkout time. It cost just under 15 SGD to get there by cab from the airport but there is a shuttle from the Pasir Ris MRT station. I took the cab because I was arriving quite late and travelling alone but I took the shuttle and MRT the next day when leaving. Shuttle was on time and the driver was very nice. So NOT your typical hostel but a good experience all the same. By hostel standards it was everything necessary, though basic. I would rate this much differently as a vacation property but even then it was clean and had all basic amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: monski0903
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Costa Sands around 2pm. Room wasn't ready yet. We we're checked in at around 4pm already and when we went into the room, it's still wasn't thoroughly cleaned. This hotel is great for a family of four because it has 4 single beds (the room we stayed in, at least). It has a very clean pool which you can do lap swimming. It has nice sorroundings. Hot and cold drinking water nearly available. A lot of fast food shops outside the resort. A water theme park nearby. Perfect for family with kids. Need a lot of improvement on the service.

Reviews.Title: “Youth hostel for the frugal business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Valrit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the International Youth Hostel Association, located close to Changi Airport, about 5 min. walk from Pasir Ris MRT. It was an unexpected pleasant surprise, since you would normally only expect very basis services from a Youth Hostel. This place, however, offers modern rooms with bathroom, wifi, free breakfast, arge swimming pool all inclusive for a very low price. If you want to combine business and holiday, this may be an option to do so. Check in is open 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay with friends”
Reviews.Author: pete7654
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a good place to stay with your friends, as there is a lot of space to hang with them without leaving the hotel. The rooms were very simple, but i did enjoy the fact that there was an xbox on the room and a BBQ pit outside. If you are looking for a quiet place, this may not be your best choise, as it can be a bit noisy sometimes. About the location, as it's a bit far from downtown, although there is a MRT station not that far with connection to the Airport and the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: amandasoh
Reviews.Content: I like there as the air-con was cool and i can also watch tv and swim at the swimming pool.The bed is nice and we can BBQ too..FOr chinese its good of course..

Reviews.Title: “Beware the bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: KevinSingapore
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 rooms for the new yr package 3d2n @ S$380. As mentioned by others, room is very simple, tiny and very few furniture. You open your front door, and voila - that's it. Service was bad - had to 'fight' with management to get choice of room - even then I still did not get my choice. There is no selection of rooms but they don't tell you that. It's only when you wanna book, then you'll find out the hard way. Asst mgr named sharguna (nicknamed tak guna) was aggressive and rude - very boorish behaviour. He might be the resort bouncer as well. Started feeling itchy especially on back and back of legs after the 2nd night. I, my wife, my sister, etc. all complained of the same side effects. Btw, my sis slept in a different room. My skin has tiny bumps when you run your fingers across. Conclusion we can draw from this is bed bugs or some sort of sand flies or whatever. Place was very noisy, cramped and polluted - bbq smell everywhere. First and last visit to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for overnight on the way to Europe”
Reviews.Author: JulijaB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is too much simple if you expect to stay as in average hotel at the price 150$. It has very simple beds and a few furniture only. Also quite noisy. Normally this is a place for young people come for picnic only. I would suggest to tourists to look for another hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Costa Sands Resort - Downtown East
HotelInfo.Address: 1 Pasir Ris Close, Singapore 519599, Singapore
